pkgmetadata.longdescription: Tools for Computation on Batch Systems // As a successor of the packages 'BatchJobs' and 'BatchExperiments', this package provides a parallel implementation of the Map function for high performance computing systems managed by schedulers 'IBM Spectrum LSF' (https://www.ibm.com/products/hpc-workload- management), 'Univa Grid Engine'/'Oracle Grid Engine' (https://altair.com/hpc-cloud-applications/), 'Slurm' (https://slurm.schedmd.com/), 'TORQUE/PBS' (https://adaptivecomputing.com/cherry-services/torque-resource- manager/), or 'Docker Swarm' (https://docs.docker.com/engine/swarm/). A multicore and socket mode allow the parallelization on a local machines, and multiple machines can be hooked up via SSH to create a makeshift cluster. Moreover, the package provides an abstraction mechanism to define large-scale computer experiments in a well-organized and reproducible way.
